Name: Falcon and owl
Description: The first side of this limestone plaque shows the head of a falcon depicted in profile. The representation is still in the initial phase: only the outline of the head and the eye are visible. Under the head, one notices a protruding board which serves as the socle. At the bottom of the plaque we find also a large base. The verso side contains a study in two parts of an owl: the head depicted from the front,  and the legs, drawn in profile.
